content: This directory lists important University of Arizona and Software Engineering websites and contacts. It is intended as a comprehensive link hub for Software Engineering students and was last updated in November 2024.

metadata.document_title: University of Arizona Software Engineering - Important Websites and Resources
metadata.note: Comprehensive list of all important websites for Software Engineering students at University of Arizona

content: The University of Arizona homepage is the main public-facing website for the university and is useful for all students.

metadata.name: University of Arizona Homepage
metadata.description: Main university website

content: UAccess Student is the main student portal used to manage registration, grades, financial aid, and student records. A login is required and it is intended for current students.

metadata.name: UAccess Student Portal
metadata.description: Student portal for registration, grades, financial aid, and student records

content: D2L Brightspace is the learning management system where students access course materials, assignments, and grades. It is for current students and requires login.

metadata.name: D2L Brightspace (Learning Management)
metadata.description: Course management system for accessing course materials, assignments, and grades

content: The Arizona Phonebook is the university directory used to look up faculty, staff, and student contact information.

metadata.name: Arizona Phonebook
metadata.description: Directory for finding faculty, staff, and student contact information

content: The College of Engineering homepage is the main site for all engineering programs and resources at the University of Arizona.

metadata.name: College of Engineering Homepage
metadata.description: Main College of Engineering website

content: The 4-Year Degree Plans page provides sample four-year academic plans for all engineering majors, including Software Engineering.

metadata.name: 4-Year Degree Plans
metadata.description: Four-year academic plans for all engineering degrees including Software Engineering

content: Engineering Student Services offers advising, support, and resources specifically for engineering students.

metadata.name: Engineering Student Services
metadata.description: Student services, advising, and support for engineering students

content: Engineering Career Services provides engineering-focused career counseling, job search support, internships, and employer connections.

metadata.name: Engineering Career Services
metadata.description: Career counseling, job search, internships, and employer connections

content: The Software Engineering homepage is the main program site for BS, MS, and PhD Software Engineering at the University of Arizona.

metadata.name: Software Engineering Homepage
metadata.description: Main Software Engineering program website

content: The SFWE Undergraduate Programs page provides BS Software Engineering program information, requirements, and advising details for undergraduates.

metadata.name: SFWE Undergraduate Programs
metadata.description: BS Software Engineering program information, requirements, and advising

content: The SFWE Graduate Programs page contains information on the MS and PhD Software Engineering programs, including requirements and admissions details for current and prospective graduate students.

metadata.name: SFWE Graduate Programs
metadata.description: MS and PhD program information, requirements, and admissions

content: The SFWE Graduate Admissions page lists application deadlines, admission requirements, and the application process for Software Engineering graduate programs.

metadata.name: SFWE Graduate Admissions
metadata.description: Graduate program application deadlines, requirements, and process

content: The SFWE Faculty Directory provides faculty profiles including research interests and contact information for Software Engineering faculty.

metadata.name: SFWE Faculty Directory
metadata.description: Faculty profiles, research interests, and contact information

content: The SFWE Student Clubs page lists student organizations and clubs related to Software Engineering and Systems & Industrial Engineering.

metadata.name: SFWE Student Clubs
metadata.description: Student organizations and clubs for Software Engineering and SIE students

content: The ECE Research Focus Areas page describes research themes in Electrical and Computer Engineering, including areas relevant to Software Engineering.

metadata.name: ECE Research Focus Areas
metadata.description: Ten research focus areas in Electrical and Computer Engineering including Software Engineering

content: The ECE Research Centers page lists internal and external research centers affiliated with the ECE department.

metadata.name: ECE Research Centers
metadata.description: External and internal research centers affiliated with ECE department

content: The Graduate College Research Resources page outlines research funding opportunities and support resources for graduate students.

metadata.name: Graduate College Research Resources
metadata.description: Research funding opportunities and resources for graduate students

content: The SFWE Course Catalog (Page 1) lists official Software Engineering courses and descriptions from the university catalog.

metadata.name: SFWE Course Catalog (Page 1)
metadata.description: Official course catalog for all SFWE courses - Page 1

content: The SFWE Course Catalog (Page 2) continues the official list and descriptions of Software Engineering courses.

metadata.name: SFWE Course Catalog (Page 2)
metadata.description: Official course catalog for all SFWE courses - Page 2

content: The University Course Catalog provides the full list of courses and academic policies for all programs at the University of Arizona.

metadata.name: University Course Catalog
metadata.description: Complete university course catalog and academic policies

content: The Schedule of Classes site lists current and upcoming semester course offerings and times.

metadata.name: Schedule of Classes
metadata.description: Current and future semester course schedules

content: The Undergraduate Admissions site provides information for freshman and transfer applicants to undergraduate programs.

metadata.name: Undergraduate Admissions
metadata.description: Freshman and transfer undergraduate admissions

content: The Graduate College Admissions page outlines admission requirements and processes for graduate programs.

metadata.name: Graduate College Admissions
metadata.description: Graduate program admissions information and requirements

content: The Graduate Application Portal is the online system where prospective MS and PhD students submit applications.

metadata.name: Application Portal
metadata.description: Graduate application portal for MS and PhD programs

content: The Slate Admissions Portal is the undergraduate application system for prospective freshman and transfer students.

metadata.name: Slate Admissions Portal
metadata.description: Undergraduate application portal

content: The Transfer Credit & Articulation Office site provides information on transfer credit evaluation and articulation agreements.

metadata.name: Transfer Credit & Articulation Office
metadata.description: Transfer credit evaluation and articulation agreements

content: The AZTransfer Course Equivalency Guide helps students search transfer credit equivalencies, including out-of-state institutions.

metadata.name: AZTransfer Course Equivalency Guide
metadata.description: Search transfer credit equivalencies for out-of-state institutions

content: The Transfer Credit Evaluation page explains how to submit and evaluate coursework from other institutions for UA credit.

metadata.name: Transfer Credit Evaluation
metadata.description: Evaluate transfer coursework from other institutions

content: The Student Financial Aid Office site covers financial aid, scholarships, grants, and loan information for students.

metadata.name: Student Financial Aid Office
metadata.description: Financial aid, scholarships, grants, and loans

content: The Tuition and Fees page lists current tuition rates and mandatory fee schedules for the university.

metadata.name: Tuition and Fees
metadata.description: Current tuition rates and fee schedules

content: The Scholarships Office page provides information on scholarship opportunities and how to apply for them.

metadata.name: Scholarships Office
metadata.description: Scholarship opportunities and application information

content: The Cost of Attendance page estimates total educational costs including tuition, housing, books, and living expenses.

metadata.name: Cost of Attendance
metadata.description: Estimated costs for tuition, housing, books, and living expenses

content: The Graduate College main website centralizes policies, resources, and information for graduate students.

metadata.name: Graduate College
metadata.description: Graduate College main website with resources and policies

content: Graduate Academic Services (GSAS) supports graduate students with academic progress, milestones, and degree completion processes.

metadata.name: Graduate Academic Services (GSAS)
metadata.description: Help with academic progress, milestones, and degree completion

content: GradPath is the online graduate portal used for submitting plans of study, tracking milestones, and completing required forms. It requires login.

metadata.name: GradPath
metadata.description: Graduate student portal for plans of study, milestones, and forms

content: The Graduate Center offers professional development, workshops, and community-building resources for graduate students.

metadata.name: Graduate Center
metadata.description: Professional development, workshops, and graduate student community

content: The Graduate Funding Resources page outlines assistantships, fellowships, and other funding opportunities for graduate students.

metadata.name: Graduate Funding Resources
metadata.description: Information on assistantships, fellowships, and funding opportunities

content: The Graduate College Fellowships Office provides fellowship listings and application support for graduate students.

metadata.name: Graduate College Fellowships Office
metadata.description: Fellowship opportunities and application support

content: The Dissertation and Thesis Formatting page provides formatting guides and templates for theses and dissertations.

metadata.name: Dissertation and Thesis Formatting
metadata.description: Formatting requirements and templates for dissertations and theses

content: The Graduate College Policies page documents academic policies, grievance procedures, and graduate requirements.

metadata.name: Graduate College Policies
metadata.description: Academic policies, grievance procedures, and requirements

content: The Engineering Academic Advising page is the main site for advising services for College of Engineering undergraduates.

metadata.name: Engineering Academic Advising
metadata.description: Academic advising for engineering students

content: The University Advising Resource Center provides general advising and connections to advising across campus.

metadata.name: University Advising Resource Center
metadata.description: General academic advising and support services

content: Think Tank offers free tutoring and academic support for a range of STEM and other courses.

metadata.name: Think Tank Tutoring
metadata.description: Free tutoring for STEM courses

content: The Writing Skills Improvement Program provides writing tutoring, consultations, and workshops.

metadata.name: Writing Skills Improvement Program
metadata.description: Writing tutoring and workshops

content: The University Libraries site gives access to library resources, research assistance, and information about study spaces.

metadata.name: University Libraries
metadata.description: Library resources, research assistance, and study spaces

content: Campus Health provides medical care, counseling, and wellness services to students.

metadata.name: Campus Health
metadata.description: Medical services, counseling, and wellness resources

content: Counseling & Psych Services (CAPS) offers mental health counseling and related support services.

metadata.name: Counseling & Psych Services (CAPS)
metadata.description: Mental health counseling and support

content: The Disability Resource Center coordinates accommodations and support for students with disabilities.

metadata.name: Disability Resource Center
metadata.description: Accommodations and support for students with disabilities

content: The Student Engagement site highlights student organizations, leadership opportunities, and involvement programs.

metadata.name: Student Engagement
metadata.description: Student organizations, leadership, and involvement opportunities

content: The Recreation Center site describes UA fitness facilities, classes, intramurals, and recreational activities.

metadata.name: Recreation Center
metadata.description: Fitness facilities, classes, and recreational activities

content: Residence Life provides information on on-campus housing options and related resources.

metadata.name: Residence Life
metadata.description: On-campus housing information and resources

content: Dining Services lists campus dining locations, menus, and meal plan options.

metadata.name: Dining Services
metadata.description: Campus dining options and meal plans

content: The main Career Services site offers career counseling, job search help, resume support, and employer connections for all students.

metadata.name: Career Services
metadata.description: Career counseling, job search, resume help, and employer connections

content: Handshake is the UA job and internship portal where students search opportunities and connect with employers. Login is required.

metadata.name: Handshake Job Portal
metadata.description: Job and internship postings for UA students

content: International Student Services supports international students with visa, immigration, and cultural adjustment issues.

metadata.name: International Student Services
metadata.description: Support for international students including visa and immigration

content: The English Language Program (CESL) offers English language courses and support for non-native speakers.

metadata.name: English Language Program
metadata.description: English language courses and support

content: The Information Technology site lists IT services, software access, and technical support resources.

metadata.name: Information Technology
metadata.description: IT services, software, and technical support

content: The NetID+ Services site is where students manage their NetID, passwords, and two-factor authentication (NetID+).

metadata.name: NetID+ Services
metadata.description: Manage NetID, passwords, and two-factor authentication

content: The UA Wi-Fi Information page provides setup instructions and support for campus wireless networks.

metadata.name: UA Wi-Fi Information
metadata.description: Campus wireless network access and setup

content: The Student Email (Gmail) portal is where students access their official university email accounts. Login is required.

metadata.name: Student Email (Gmail)
metadata.description: Student email access

content: The Software Downloads site lists free and discounted software available to UA students.

metadata.name: Software Downloads
metadata.description: Free and discounted software for students

content: The Academic Calendar lists important dates such as semester start and end dates, deadlines, and university holidays.

metadata.name: Academic Calendar
metadata.description: Important academic dates, deadlines, and holidays

content: The Final Exam Schedule page lists official final exam times for each semester.

metadata.name: Final Exam Schedule
metadata.description: Final examination schedule for each semester

content: The Registrar's Office site covers registration, transcripts, enrollment verification, and degree certification services.

metadata.name: Registrar's Office
metadata.description: Registration, transcripts, enrollment verification, and degree certification

content: The Transcripts page explains how to order official university transcripts.

metadata.name: Transcripts
metadata.description: Order official transcripts

content: The Grading Policies page outlines the university's grading system and related policies.

metadata.name: Grading Policies
metadata.description: University grading policies and procedures

content: The Enrollment Verification page is used to verify enrollment for loans, insurance, and other purposes.

metadata.name: Enrollment Verification
metadata.description: Verify enrollment for loans, insurance, etc.

content: The University Police site provides information on campus safety services and emergency response.

metadata.name: University Police
metadata.description: Campus safety and emergency services

content: The UAlert Emergency Notifications site is where students sign up for campus emergency alerts.

metadata.name: UAlert Emergency Notifications
metadata.description: Sign up for emergency alerts and notifications

content: The Campus Safety Resources site consolidates safety tips, resources, and emergency procedures.

metadata.name: Campus Safety Resources
metadata.description: Safety tips, resources, and emergency procedures

content: The SFWE Graduate Program Coordinator email is the primary contact for MS and PhD Software Engineering program questions.

metadata.name: SFWE Graduate Program Coordinator
metadata.description: Contact for MS and PhD program questions and support

content: The Transfer Credit Articulation email is used for questions about transfer credit evaluation.

metadata.name: Transfer Credit Articulation
metadata.description: Questions about transfer credit evaluation

content: The Engineering Advising email address is a direct contact for undergraduate academic advising questions in the College of Engineering.

metadata.name: Engineering Advising
metadata.description: Academic advising questions

content: The Office of Institutional Equity site is where students can learn about and report discrimination, harassment, or civil rights concerns.

metadata.name: Office of Institutional Equity
metadata.description: Report discrimination, harassment, or civil rights concerns

content: The Dean of Students site provides student advocacy, conduct processes, and support services.

metadata.name: Dean of Students
metadata.description: Student advocacy and support services

content: The Campus Maps site offers an interactive map of the University of Arizona campus, including building locations.

metadata.name: Campus Maps
metadata.description: Interactive campus map with building locations

content: The Parking & Transportation site covers parking permits, transit options, and campus shuttle information.

metadata.name: Parking & Transportation
metadata.description: Parking permits, transit options, and campus shuttles

content: The Campus Bookstore site provides access to textbooks, supplies, and UA merchandise.

metadata.name: Campus Bookstore
metadata.description: Textbooks, supplies, and UA merchandise

content: The LifeWorks site lists child care, elder care, and other work-life resources, especially helpful for graduate students.

metadata.name: LifeWorks (Work-Life Balance)
metadata.description: Child care, elder care, and work-life resources

content: The Research Computing HPC site describes high-performance computing resources available for research projects.

metadata.name: Research Computing HPC
metadata.description: High-performance computing resources for research

content: CyVerse provides cyberinfrastructure and tools that support data-driven life sciences research.

metadata.name: CyVerse
metadata.description: Cyberinfrastructure for life sciences research

content: The Honors College site explains honors program opportunities, requirements, and benefits for high-achieving students.

metadata.name: Honors College
metadata.description: Honors program opportunities and requirements

content: The Study Abroad site lists international study opportunities and programs for UA students.

metadata.name: Study Abroad
metadata.description: International study opportunities

content: The Alumni Association site connects alumni with networking, events, and benefits, and is also useful for graduating students.

metadata.name: Alumni Association
metadata.description: Alumni network and benefits
